images.alt: A screenshot of the Godot game engine, showing a selection list on the left and a diagram on the right linking a box with details about the smelter tile to two boxes for dirt and rock tiles. The tab is called placement, indicating that the smelter is restricted to just these tiles.
images.title: Tile Placement Tool
images.description: This tool allows me to more easily see and change which tiles can be placed on top of which other tiles, as well as change other tile data.

images.alt: A screenshot of the Godot game engine, showing a selection list on the left and a diagram on the right linking a box with details about the smelter tile to a box for a mine tiles. The tab is called adjacency, and the info in the mine tile indicates that placing a mine by a smelter will increase the smelter's stone yield per turn by 1.
images.title: Tile Adjacency Tool
images.description: This tool allows me to see and change which tiles have effects on others when placed next to them, and what those effects are.

images.alt: A screenshot of a hexagonal grid on a grey background, with several types of tiles unlocked: forest, grass, river, sand, and dirt. The outermost tiles are greyed out.
images.title: Hex Map
images.description: This is an example of the map as it currently looks. When a tile is unlocked, any adjacent invisible tiles will be revealed.

images.alt: A screenshot of a Godot inspector, displaying several settings related to thresholds and noise values for terrain generation.
images.title: Terrain Generation Settings
images.description: These settings contain references to each of the terrain tiles, threshold levels for easy adjustment, and noise textures for different values.
